body:
`spack spec --yaml <spec>` used to produce a machine-readable representation of the spec information for a package and its dependencies. Now, it just produces an error:
```
spack spec --yaml boost
==> Error: argument of type 'module' is not iterable
```

Use of `git bisect`identifies commit 4a54178ff as the culprit.

### Information on your system

Scientific Linux 7.4 with Python 2.7.5 using Spack at the head of develop.

FAO: @adamjstewart @tgamblin
title: spack spec --yaml has been broken on develop since April
